title: A split floor plan, the primary suite has multiple closets, a nice bat
description: Beautiful Apartment, small neighborhood with similar styled patio homes, and sidewalks throughout. Built in 2022, this brick home with stucco accents has great curb appeal with a landscaped yard (supported by a sprinkler system) and we love the look of the plantation shutters! Walking in, The updated kitchen has white cabinets, stainless appliances, granite counters, a stainless vented hood above the cooking range, you’ll notice wide plank hardwood floors throughout the entertainment area along with crown molding throughout the home. At the front door, there is an open formal dining room that has room for any size table. The living room is a cozy space with a gas log fireplace and double tray ceilings with crown molding on both trays. a kitchen desk, and a tile backsplash to complete the look. A split floor plan, the primary suite has multiple closets, a nice bathroom ensuite with separate shower and jetted tub, and an adjacent office with built-in cabinets that has the same hardwood flooring as the entrance. On the opposite side of the home, there are 2 bedrooms lined with crown molding and the 2nd full bath. There is a sunroom on the back that overlooks the yard and has access doors from both the breakfast area and the primary bedroom. The backyard has a patio with built-in gas grill and concrete pathways leading to the front yard on either side. A added bonus, there is a 220v plug in the garage for an electric car. The roof was replaced in 2022 and brought up to a bronze fortified status, ask your agent about a discount on your home insurance. Gutters have been added in several key places. The HVAC and smart thermostat were updated in 2022. Email me by including your email address and cell number to contact you directly.

These students will need a room for 1 month or longer, depending on their situation. Pay Rates: 14 meals a week (continental breakfast and dinner) Single room: $200 per student per week Being a host family for an international student can be a rewarding experience for both students and hosts. Our families reflect the diversity of families in North America including young, senior and single-parent families, families with teenagers or families with Our hosts don't have to be from the US originally, but we do ask that they are fluent in English in order to give our students real world English language practice. Although we have many different kinds of families, they all share a willingness to open their hearts and homes to our international students. At KI, new students arrive weekly and their length of stay ranges from two weeks to one year. Our students are 16+, with the average age being around 19-20 - but often, we get students in their 20s, 30s, and sometimes 40s - 60s! Generally, students request the homestay booking of two meals a day, continental breakfast and dinner, and a clean room with a bed and desk for the students. Students book with us in advance, then we place them with host families - but all of our students are primarily here to study English at our school. One important factor in deciding whether a host can join our program is their location. We ask that host families live within a maximum 90-minute commute to Kaplan (located in Downtown Seattle), and close to public transportation, as we don't ask hosts to take students to school. Rental application Criteria Application
Resident Screening Policy
Before you apply to rent an apartment home in my home, please take the time to review this screening policy. All persons 18 years of age or older will be required to complete a rental application.
It is the policy of this community to comply with all applicable fair housing laws including those which prohibit discrimination against any person based on race, color, creed, sex or gender, familial status (having or expecting a child under 18), national origin, disability (physical or mental), age (18 and older), sexual orientation, marital status or source of income. The following may be completed on all applicants: credit check, rental history verification, income verification and criminal history verification.
1. Occupancy Guidelines - Are based on local town/city and/or fire code ordinances Bethlehem City guidelines
2. Age - Applicants must be 18 years of age or older unless deemed to be an adult under applicable law with respect to the execution of contracts.
3. Credit - A credit report will be completed on all applicants to verify credit ratings. Verifiable income along with verified credit history will be entered into a credit scoring model to determine rental eligibility and security deposit levels. Unfavorable accounts will negatively influence this score.
4. Income - Gross income will be combined and entered into the credit scoring model for income eligibility. All applicants will be required to provide consecutive pay stubs for up to 4 weeks from the date of application. If handwritten pay stubs are supplied, the documents must be notarized. Applicants must have a combined income of at least 3 times the monthly rent and 4 time the monthly rent for Guarantor applicants. Additional sources of verifiable income may be considered including but not limited to: child support, pensions, GI benefits, disability, trust funds, social security & all other lawful sources of income; federal, state, local, non-profit and subsidized programs.
5. Employment - If applicant has not yet started their employment, the applicant may provide "a letter of intent" or "offer letter" from the intended employer.
6. Self-employment, retired or unemployed - Such applicants must provide the previous year's income tax return as well as the last 3 months of bank statements from the date of application.
7. Criminal History - A criminal background check will be performed for each applicant and occupant age 18 years or older. Your application may be denied based on activity that would threaten the health, safety, or right to enjoy the community by other residents. Your application may also be denied if such criminal activities threaten the safety of property owners, employees, vendors or any other community affiliated parties.
8. Rental History - Rental history verification will not only include current and/or previous financial responsibility but will also include verification of complying with landlord rules, community policies, etc.
9. Guarantors - The guarantor will be required to complete an application and pay the full application fee. Guarantors must have a gross monthly income of 2.o times the monthly rent and meet all other qualifying criteria identified in this screening policy. Guarantors will be required to sign the Lease and will remain financially liable during the entire residency of the applicant(s). Should tenant move out prior to the lease expiration, the Guarantor will remain financially liable until all terms have been fulfilled.
10. Pets – No Pets
11. Falsification of Application - Any falsification in Applicant's paperwork will result in the automatic denial of Application. In the event that an Applicant falsifies their paperwork, Owner has the right to hold all deposits and fees paid to apply towards liquidated damages.  If interested call contact information, or leave message .  show contact info

description:

1 Bedroom apartment for rent in the South Amboy business district.
• Newly renovated 2nd floor apartment.

• Walking distance to train station, many restaurants/bars, specialty shops, police department, etc.
• Rent ($1,300/month) INCLUDES all utilities: Heat, Hot Water, and Electric.
• No Pets allowed.
Apartment includes:
• Living Room with Pergo Laminate floor and built in air conditioner.
• Bedroom with large closet that has shelving on both sides.
• Full Bathroom with closet.
• Kitchen with large walk in pantry and shelving.
• New refrigerator, sink, sink basin, countertops, and range hood.
• Gas stove.
• Private rear entrance with deck.
Proof of steady income REQUIRED. Looking for those who have been employed for at least the past 6 months in their current role.
Apartment cannot exceed 36% of take home income: 45,000/year Minimum ($22/hr). No Exceptions.
1-1/2 month ($1,950) security deposit required.
Lease Term is 1 year. Willing to do month-to-month after 1 year expiration.
Note: Certificate of Occupancy is for up to 2 adults and 1 child under the age of 3.
I legally cannot rent if you have multiple children or a child age 3 or older living with you.
There will be a no fee application for those interested. Please bring a pen to fill it out. You will not be considered for the apartment if your application is not on file.

-Sunday (September 18th) at 10:30am-11:30am or 7:30pm-8:30pm
-Monday (September 19th) at 7:00pm
-Wednesday (September 21st) at 7:00pm
-Saturday (September 24th) at 10:30am - 11:30am
Call or text Jeff (7:00am - 10:00pm) at the number listed to schedule a viewing of the apartment at one of the above scheduled times.
*Note: I generally cannot answer my phone at work (Weekdays 8:00am - 5:00pm). If voicemail answers please mention apartment and clearly/slowly state name, call back number, and best time to reach you.
Text messaging is ok and I will reply as available.
E-mail will only be responded to once per day, usually late evening.

title: Room for rent in South Jersey home with a beautiful garden
description:
Looking to rent out a private bedroom and bathroom in this home. The house is located in South Jersey and features a fantastic location close to plenty of weekend activities and easy access to shopping. The home also features a lovely garden and a large backyard.
The room is located on the second floor of the home and would come with access to a washer and dryer as well as a full kitchen and living room. There is also parking available in the driveway. The room is furnished and comes with a king sized bed, bed side tables and a dresser. There is also a closet found inside the room which the renter would be able to use. If you are a big lover of the outdoors this would be a perfect spot for you as the home features a beautifully maintained front and backyard with plenty of patio seating.
I am retired and love working in my garden. I also enjoy spending time with my grandchildren and being active at my church. I love people and enjoy helping others and meeting new friends. I also enjoy laughing and having fun, as well as entertaining guests. There is also a small dog that calls this their home! So a renter would have to be a dog lover.
An ideal renter for this space would be someone who is kind and clean. It is really important that the common areas of the home are kept clean after use. A renter would also need to be respectful of the house they are in and the owner! I am asking for $725 a month for this space!

title: Hello I am looking for one month rental in downtown Manhattan area .
description:
Hello I am looking for one month rental in downtown Manhattan area . I need individual /shared room . Move in from 5th Oct until 4th Nov . I am a working professional .Hey everyone. My names Bonnie from Victoria Tx. I'm currently planning on moving to New York permanently. Needing help with housing and finding a job.Hello, A LOW-BUDGET MOVIE PRODUCTION FROM INDIA SEEKING A SMALL LIVE IN A STUDIO FOR 2 /WORKSHOP/OFFICE FOR SIX MONTHS TO ONE YEAR FOR MEETINGS/CASTING AND RESTING FACILITY WITH TWO CAR PARKING MINIMUM INDUSTRIAL FACILITY OK filming will be shot around greater Los Angeles STARTING OCT THIS YEAR FAIR RENTAL OK TWO-MEMBER TEAM ARRIVING ON OCT 1ST CONTACT LOCAL MANAGER FOR MORE My name is Kamel, I'm s Real Estate Agent, doing rentals since 2004, very experienced in rentals in Staten island & Brooklyn I have a client is looking for a 3 BR apartment, willing to spend $2600/month -- Details : 3 professional roommates * Work: 2 are Uber drivers & 3rd one is a construction worker * Combined Income: $160k/ yr plus * Credit: above 700 Score * Currently living: 48th St & 4th Ave, Sunset park, Brooklyn (for 7 yrs) * Reason of moving out: living in 2 BR apartment (want a bigger apartment) * Area desired: Bay ridge, Dyker heights, Bensonhurst, Boro park, Sunset park Hello I am seeking a roommate that is willing to pay up to 1500 for a decent apartment with me. We will seek a 2 bed 2 bath place. I am a but It does not matter who wants to get a place with me. I have decent credit too. Mature, 27yr old-soul DV survivor & 9yo daughter need housing. We are currently living in a shelter that I'm pretty sure is not even up-to-code and we're quickly growing weary. I work full-time for a non-profit. She's in elementary school. We are quiet, clean, and respectful people. I am drug/tobacco-free with no criminal record. I have excellent credit with no evictions and can provide references. I'm offering $900-$1000 a month and will pay a higher deposit if you would so require. Our birthdays (one month apart) are coming up and nothing would be more wonderful than a real place to live! You are preferably a landlord with a living space like a ADU/granny flat/studio/1-bedroom, you are needing to rent out. In a location near the downtown San Diego area or to public transportation. You're also drug/tobacco-free. I'm not asking for much in the way of housing; just for a safe place where we can wear earplugs to bed because we want to, not because we have to, ya know? Please include the phrase, "arms of the angel" in your reply so I know that you are not a bot. Independent thinker with great references & manners. Need temp housing, ideally your a gay man, nudist if vibe and place is appropriate. Putting most my things in storage and open to opportunities so today I am seeling a room for a week or two to start, ideally vibe and energy is welcoming for more permanent situation but a week or two can provide exactly what is needed now Thanks for considering my post I’m looking for a room to rent somewhere in the west side. I can pay a security deposit, I’m ok with sharing a bathroom, I’m clean and I’m not home very often, I work a lot. Please contact me with any availability. I am from San Jose, and was looking at places UNDER 560/mo. I'm just scanning to see if it is possible whatsoever. I don't mind if the sq footage is extremely small and tight (as expected for such a price). The location I'm looking for is San Jose/Santa Clara. Don't mind as long as it is within 20 mi of it. Anybody have any leads? Is apartments.com or facebook a better for super cheap finds? Any help and suggestions would be appreciated. Thanks I want a private room to rent up to 560 I'm senior citizen in good health. no smoking no drinking no low/hi noise clean respectful pay on time. Pl let me know we can have a good deal for you! I want a private room to rent up to 560 I'm senior citizen in good health. no smoking no drinking no low/hi noise clean respectful pay on time. Weekly fee is $175. (*taxes & fees not included) It includes ALL utilities and services! (heat, gas, cable, electric, parking etc.) START SAVING YOUR MONEY TODAY! title: 3 Bed, 1 Bath Rent/Lease with a Right to Buy in Drexel Hill
description:
Welcome home to your beautifully renovated, turn-key home in Drexel Hill, available as a rent-to-purchase opportunity!
This lovely Drexel Hill rowhome is the one you've been searching for! Welcome to this recently renovated home featuring a modern color scheme throughout, newer windows and new engineered hardwood flooring on the first and second floors. Enter the home into the large and bright living room where you will find an electric fireplace and the partially open staircase. Flow into the formal dining room before making your way into the kitchen where you will find white stained cabinets with vintage fixtures and stainless steel dishwasher and refrigerator. The corner nook with a ceiling fan allows for a small breakfast table. Upstairs, you will find three bedrooms each with hardwood flooring and the hall bathroom is centrally located. Making your way to the lower level, you will find a large, finished basement with newer carpeting. This space can be used as a second living area, playroom, office space or any combination to suit your ever-changing needs. On this level, you will also find a washer and dryer, access to the one-car garage and a rear alleyway for additional parking for one car. Located near the elementary school and local parks, making this home perfect for a family or anyone with four-legged friends while the quick access to SEPTA bus routes, all major highways, and PIA add convenience for the everyday commuter! Buy with peace of mind knowing all major components of the home have been recently replaced and a transferable one year home warranty provided at settlement!
Basic Requirements to Qualify: - Household income of $76,500 and above - Credit score of 550 and above - No evictions/late rent payments, or car repossessions in the past year, and no recurring overdrafts - Student loans must be in good standing (not in default) - Bankruptcy must be discharged - $4,500 upfront for move in.  The application is free and only requires a soft credit pull.  Savings program of $325 per month, for a total cost of $2,125 per month.
Reach out for more information and for next steps in scheduling a private showing today!

description:
The home at 315 is available for lease at this moment! This 575 square foot Warhol one bedroom one bathroom apartment home on the 3rd floor features large windows that mainly face south and have a view of Chancellor Street. One window in the living and dining room area faces west for morning shade and afternoon sunshine and has a park view. This renovated kitchen is nice with its white cabinets and granite countertops. This kitchen is fully-equipped with a dishwasher, disposal, microwave, and gas stove. The renovated bathroom tile is white. This home has neutral carpet. The Rittenhouse Claridge is located on Rittenhouse Square. Move into your new home as early as September 24, 2022!
The Rittenhouse Claridge offers you the opportunity to live in Philadelphia’s most vibrant, walkable neighborhood. So close to shopping, dining, and more! Go grocery shopping at the Rittenhouse Market, Sue's Produce Market, Trader Joe's, Giant, Target, Di Bruno Bros., Aldi, Reading Terminal Market, Giant Heirloom Market, Whole Foods, or Sprouts. Stroll across the park and then grab a French baguette at Metropolitan Bakery. Buy scones from The Bakeshop on 20th. Catch a show at one of the many nearby theaters. Wander around the Rodin Museum or Barnes Foundation. Check out the Mutter Museum. Relax with a manicure or pedicure at Philly Nails Bar, Spa Nail Bar, or Coco Blue Spruce. Shop at the weekly farmer's market every Saturday and Tuesday from 9:00 AM to 2:00 PM. There is so much to do in this area!
